landmarks.name: Kylemore Abbey
landmarks.expanded: Set in a dramatic landscape, Kylemore is an ideal destination for a day out. Kylemore is steeped in history and tales of tragedy, romance, engineering initiatives, model farms, royal visits, spirituality, and education. Experience the Victorian atmosphere of the restored rooms of the Abbey and neo-Gothic church.

landmarks.name: Galway Cathedral
landmarks.expanded: Galway Cathedral, which was dedicated in 1965, was the last major stone cathedral to be built in Europe. Located in the heart of Galway City, the cathedral boasts an impressive variety of interior art, such as statues, mosaics and stained glass.

landmarks.name: Aran Islands
landmarks.expanded: The Aran Islands are located just off Galway and Doolin. A true Irish experience awaits, locals speak Irish as well as English in a setting of Celtic churches of historical significance. The Aran Islands are a great choice for special holiday

landmarks.name: Connemara National Park
landmarks.expanded: Discover the rugged beauty of Connemara National Park, located on the western coast of Ireland. Explore scenic hiking trails, spot diverse wildlife, and marvel at breathtaking landscapes including mountains, bogs, and woodlands.

landmarks.name: Lynchs Castle
landmarks.expanded: Lynch's Castle is a medieval fortified house located on Shop Street in the heart of Galway city. The castle is renowned for its elaborate Gothic-style architecture and rich history. Today, Lynch's Castle stands as a cherished heritage site, offering visitors a glimpse into Galway's medieval past.

landmarks.name: Salthill Promenade
landmarks.expanded: Enjoy a leisurely stroll along the picturesque Salthill Promenade, offering breathtaking views of Galway Bay and the majestic Atlantic Ocean. Immerse yourself in the soothing sounds of the waves as they rhythmically caress the sandy beaches, while the salty sea breeze invigorates your senses

restaurants.name: An Pucan
restaurants.expanded: The award-winning An Púcán is a real crowd-pleaser. Found just off the iconic Eyre Square, on Forster Street, this bar has been drawing crowds for a long time, thanks to its delicious grub, cracking cocktails, and unforgettable atmosphere.

restaurants.name: Oscars
restaurants.expanded: Oscars is a perfect bistro to enjoy a selection of real local foods in particular the Seafood freshly caught off the coast of Galway and sourced from local fishermen and the best of Galways fishmongers.

restaurants.name: The Cellar Bar and Resturaunt
restaurants.expanded: The Cellar Bar has grown into a local favorite, with the emphasis being on comfort, value and entertainment. The Cellar Bar’s famous food menu offers a diverse range of meals for every taste and budget, and will ensure you never leave hungry.

restaurants.name: The Jungle Cafe
restaurants.expanded: Step into a lush, jungle-inspired ambiance where every corner reveals delightful surprises. Enjoy freshly brewed artisanal coffee, mouthwatering pastries, and delectable light bites. Perfect for catching up with friends or unwinding after a busy day. Let the urban jungle adventure begin!

restaurants.name: Cafe Nero
restaurants.expanded: Experience the warmth of Italian hospitality in the heart of Galway. Indulge in rich espresso blends, expertly crafted pastries, and savory sandwiches. Whether you're seeking a quick caffeine fix or a cozy spot to linger over a book, Café Nero offers the perfect retreat. Join us for a taste of la dolce vita!

restaurants.name: Tomodachi
restaurants.expanded: Tomodachi is a cozy Japanese eatery nestled in the heart of Galway, offering a wide array of authentic Japanese dishes, including sushi, sashimi, ramen, and bento boxes. With its warm ambiance and friendly staff, Tomodachi provides a delightful dining experience that transports guests to the vibrant streets of Japan.

activities.name: Wildlands Galway
activities.expanded: Experience thrilling adventure activities at Wildlands Galway. Test your skills on the high ropes course, navigate through treetop obstacles, and zoom down zip lines. Enjoy outdoor fun for all ages with activities such as archery, climbing walls, and nature walks.

activities.name: Great Escape Rooms
activities.expanded: Enter the world of mystery and intrigue at Great Escape Rooms Galway. Choose from a variety of immersive escape room experiences and put your problem-solving skills to the test. Work together with your team to uncover clues, solve puzzles, and escape before time runs out!

activities.name: Galway City Museum
activities.expanded: Explore the history, heritage, and culture of Galway City and the surrounding area. The museum features exhibits on archaeology, history, and art, with a focus on the city's maritime history and the Claddagh fishing community.

activities.name: Electric Nightclub
activities.expanded: Electric is one of Galway's most popular nightclubs, located in the heart of the city. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and great music, Electric is a must-visit spot for party-goers in Galway.

activities.name: Palas
activities.expanded: Palas is a three screen arthouse cinema and cultural space in the UNESCO city of film - Galway. Palas is a concrete monolith, five storey over double-height basement housing a three-screen independent cinema, a beautiful bar and restaurant for you to enjoy with your fellow film-lovers.

activities.name: River Corrib Kayaking
activities.expanded: Experience the tranquil beauty of Galway's waterways with a kayaking adventure along the picturesque River Corrib. Paddle through lush green landscapes, past historic landmarks, and under charming bridges while enjoying the serenity of nature.
